commit_message:
Update README.md

Fixed formatting.

Added decompression for *.gz. In the future, there will be an option on the data step that asks if data is compressed and the user chooses compression and if not listed, then they are advised to decompress or change the compression to a supported format.

Added unique seed to the details page of each job.
Fixed duplicate key/step for the overall jobs list.
Added an additional method to check for the status of a job.
Added storage of SSH usernames to facilitate this status update check.
Crudely removed the ability to press enter on the create page so that the form won't submit prior to all the information being added by the user. This will need to be refined in the future.

Fixed conversion bug.

Added extra redundancy for init script.
Updated the qsub command to reflect back-end changes on BigDog.

Added masurca steps.
Fixed minor bug resulting in the inability to delete a user in some cases.
Removed un-used statics and comments.

Fixed javascript bug that occurred when an error was caught in the controller and control was sent back to the view. The user was then unable to move backward in the wizard because the stepList was null.

Fixed a display bug following the situation above where step 2 wouldn't display the checked information.

Started modifying how the model is implemented.

Couple fixes.
Fixed logic error when verifying cluster account.

Added an error parameter into the genome model in an effort to transition from session data to a more realistic solution (and less complicated one).

Removed a lot of the viewbags and replaced with model data.

Transititioned sensitive information from source code to more secure sources.

Various bug fixes.
Removed old comment.

Confirmed the compression and upload work.

Reworked the display of the progress bars for the job steps a bit to be more straightforward.

Various bug fixes.

Added the completed case so that it won't update if the job is marked completed.

Added default case if there is an out of bounds on the steps just as a precaution. Resets the step state to default and goes through all the steps.

Made the step size static which makes programming for the state of a job much easier.

Redesigned the job maintenance method to be more straight forward.

Modified the model to put the number of assemblers back in and removed the overallsteps since that is no longer needed.

Various bug fixes.

Made significant changes to the way a job is updated.

Combined the zip and upload step. Makes it easier to ensure that the compression occurs BEFORE attempting to upload the data (eliminates the possibility someone updating a large job in rapid succession causing malfunctions in the logic).

Several bug fixes.

TODO: Still need to remove some extra methods no longer being used. Keeping for now in case there is some use.

Changes are largely untested but have been independently verified for their functionality.

Verified functionality of the ZIP command.

Modified documentation.

Cleaned up code and made it more concise. Added a lot of debugging to make it easier/cleaner to work with non-assembler tests.

Various bug fixes (especially with how the update functions are done).

Changed the way in which errors in steps are deteremined and relayed back internally.

Improved code readability and maintenance.

Made a model change to include the number of overall steps the job will contain. Since this will vary by job, it makes sense to include this information.

I modified the classes that depend on this data to fit the new model.

Added the seed value to the model. It will always be unique and the way in which a job is identified due to the fact that a UUID isn't determined quick enough for me to use it in the naming schema. So I needed another unique identifier.

Made the various changes

Removed cd command since renci doesn't care about CWD and requires aboslute pathing on everything.

Updated documentation and removed old comments.

Added support for private key access for updating the job.

Verified functionality of updating the status of a job until the point of it needing to be uploaded.

Made the bars on the details page of a job dynamic with the current state of the job.

Various bug fixes.

Various bug fixes for then scheduler call.

Fixed some of the markup so the data sources are a bit more presentable.

Changed the name of Locations to a more apt description.

Changed the way errors are handled to be a bit more efficient and easier to maintain.

Changed the way some of the methods work in the Manage Roles in order to facilitate a more direct method approach.

Various minor bug fixes.

Combined two classes and renamed it to be more descriptive.

Fixed an issue with windows writing a carriage return at the end of the files on the ftp.

Created the verify account class to consolidate that process in its own class.

Various bug fixes.

Rewrote the config builder to be more efficient and concise.
Rewrote the url checker to be more extendable and concise.
Cleaned up the TestJobUrls method to be more concise and return something that made sense.

Various other bug fixes.

Verified functionality of the url data verification check. Had to split up the checks and output to a file due to the varying degree of outputs. This may need to be appended with additional checks if some additional cases are encountered.

Made a lot of bash fixes for commands. Fixed several issues with the config builder and set it up (and verified) its use on the server. It works as intended.

Still have issues with verifying the download links. I left a comment.
Fixed issue where the error wouldn't redisplay after attempting to remove the final URL during the assembly creation wizard.
JS fix for textboxes not adding properly in the create assembly page.

Added a fix for authorization not actually evaluating a user's roles properly.

Verified authorization support for assembly create page.

Added future support for exception/authorization logging on the backend.

Significant dependency updates.
Changed username back to email so authentication is re-enabled.

Removed custom filter authentication. TODO: Implement dependency injection.
Don't display the create a job page unless the user's account has been verified. Also added an error page.
Updated the Verify code to be a bit more helpful in terms of feedback for a user upon completion of the test.

Fixed issue with null reference when pushed to IIS.

Fixed some LINQ command structures.

Other updates/modifications for deployment.
Updated Documentation.

Updated documentation.

Moved a method to a different class and tweaked the way it worked.
Updated documentation.

Reduced a bit of the code as well as added documentation.

Changed most of the messages to better reflect the current situation as well as simplified the ViewBag displaying the information.

Added documentation to a significant portion of the project.

Added the connection string with the ip/pass removed.

Removed superfluous information on the login page.
Added some data validation for function parameters.
Made small changes and added documentation.
Fixed the forward/backward issue. It now works for at least 3 assemblers (and n-steps) moving forward.
Everything works except the ability to go backwards consistently. It works only in specific cases. Maybe re-thinking my approach tomorrow.

Significant changes to the way the validation is done for the job creation. The way each step is handled in a more efficient and predictable way making it easier to handle more than one assembler.

Needed to change to a more dynamic approach.

Not finished yet. Still working out the kinks.
Added custom data annotation for email address to make sure it is an SIU email address and not already in the database. Also added dawg tag validation as well.
Added tooltip functionality.

Merge pull request #11 from taylorflatt/Data_Source_Revamp

Added error checking to the URLs

Added error checking for the data source. Essentially it will make a connection to bigdog with their account and download the header information to each data URL and if ANY fails, then the url will be returned to the user with an error. Otherwise, the program proceedes normally.

This won't stop future faults because things can change from submission of the job to the actual execution. But it might catch some errors.

Merge pull request #10 from taylorflatt/Data_Source_Revamp

Data source revamp

Accounted for the case in which two users simultaneously create a job and try to create directories and information. Can't count on the uuid since it is added only when the job is added to the DB, so I had to create a seed value which is used to uniquely identify the script name on the server.

I pass the script URLs directly into the ssh config script rather than referencing them in the locations file. Alternatively, I could also pass in the single seed value into a method in locations which would grab the correct information. Later that might be the best solution when I get beyond 2 methods.

Fixed javascript error when using sequential reads.
Removed old code from the config builder and updated the config builder to reflect a more modern sense of the project.
Fixed a bug (not sure how it got this far) where I didn't have a standard deviation or mean for jump reads or sequential data. I generalized the model parameter and included it for all data sets.

Updated the ConfigBuilder  initscript builder to handle the set-based URL structure. This is rudimentary and will need to be elevated to rename to the filetype downloaded. Right now it is very single-case.
Fixed the concat so it will concat the sets. The concats are done by sets so L1,R1,L2,R2,L3,R3 which is a predictable pattern and easily parsed later on.

Removed random code that added a URL box when PEReads was checked (oops).

Fixed some more formatting so now the error for each row will appear on the same line.

Fixed bug with checking sequential reads. x = 1 does not necessarily mean sequential reads (since we treat it as relating to a SET of urls). Instead, I check for whether or not the sequential reads checkbox has been checked.

Updated the way in which the x is treated. Instead of x referring to a single URL, it refers to a SET of textboxes. That means it refers to a L/R or a L for sequential.

So I updated the error checking to reflect the change in perspective.
Fixed bug where the URLs wouldn't display properly.
The URL boxes are adding but after adding a 3rd row, the style gets messed for undetermined reasons.
Added model parameter for sequential reads.
Added scaffolding to create page for the LEFT and RIGHT reads for non-sequential data.
Merge unique_username.

Fixed a few display issues with the manage roles.

Added the user part of the email (everything before the @ symbol) be the username. Verified by creating an account and managing it via manage roles.

Merge pull request #8 from taylorflatt/Unique_Dawg_Tag

Unique dawg tag
Removed extra using statement.

Added the UniqueDawgTag data annotation to check if a dawgtag exists in the database at registration.

Tested works on registration. Need to check that it works when modifying the model.
Added cancel image.

Merge pull request #7 from taylorflatt/Step_Descriptions

Step descriptions

Updated the validation so the user can't leave the data step until they select their data type (it is mutually exclusive and must be one of the options).

Offloaded some of the work of the controller to a helper method to clean it up a bit.
Updated the Locations with a better structure and added documentation.
Updated documentation.
The previous way of using the offset variable wouldn't work. Need to call the size of the hashtable instead when getting the correct step.

Added the error constants in the step description.

Removed unnecessary parameters for getters in the step descriptions.

Changed the way I set the overall status in the update status method.

Merge pull request #6 from taylorflatt/Step_Descriptions

Fixed some logic in the main method.

Fixed some logic in the main method.

Added a constant that refers to the initial step which is referenced in the initial job creation so that I don't need to call a complex method to get the first step (which it will always be the first step).
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/taylorflatt/distributed-genomic-assembly.git

Changed the way step descriptions are handled so it is more generic. This isn't fully implemented yet.

Fixed a couple bugs.

Added files via upload

Uploaded the user documentation as well as the Design documentation as it currently stands. These should (and will) be updated throughout the course of the project.
Fixed a bug where the admin count wasn't returning properly.

Merge pull request #5 from taylorflatt/Update_Job

Update job

Fixed bug when removing a role from a user. Another role wouldn't be added to it causing a whole host of other issues like the list of users and their roles not populating.

So I restructured the way the remove role method was done and made sure the user was added to the role right below them.
Fixed an issue where the Job Status header would display if the job completed.

Added the SIU to the user view.

TODO: Change everything over to a viewmodel in my ManageViewModels class. Viewbags aren't the proper way of displaying some of the stuff to the views.

Merge pull request #4 from taylorflatt/Update_Job

Update job
Added the ability view the number of submitted jobs along with a couple statistics in the manage.
Added a FAQ page as well as updated the About page.

Fixed a bug where attempting to remove a url would display an error but then entering valid information and moving to the next step would still display the error if the user goes back to the step.

Removed the update/cancel job buttons from being visible when a job has completed successfully. It doesn't make sense for them to still be displayed.
Added the download link to the viewjobs page if it exists.

Added the feature where the "Get Started" button changes depending on whether or not the user has completed the verification process on their account.

Added the refresh status and cancel status buttons and logic. They aren't fully tested but actually run when clicked.

Made a few other minor bug fixes as well.

Added signalR for the active job updates possible in lieu of the other method I was going to use.

Also fixed error on the main page with the links not linking to the correct pages in all instances.
Fixed a few bugs. Added some view information for the current job state.

Added hangfire.io to handle the background tasks when I get around to implement them for the update job. This may change but the library seems solid and handles a lot of the trouble cases that could arise from manually handling it.

Added a download link parameter to the model so we can update that once the job has successfully been uploaded.

TODO: Set the buttons and notifications on the details page.

Methodized the job upload portion of the update.

I changed the way the update actually runs. I renamed it and gave it a jobsToUpload which is passed by ref and allows me to specify whether the particular job being passed into the method is in need of upload to the FTP in the calling location. Handy since I need to know whether or not to call UploadData.

Finished the updateall method but a lot of it needs to be methodized so that the statuses will update correctly.

As it stands now, if a job is deemed to be "completed" (success OR failure), it will carry out doing the compression/sftp connection/uploading of the data. Assuming the worst case, that could be a couple hundred gbs. That could take awhile and we would want to move onto other jobs AND give those intermediate updates to the user as to what their job is doing.

Unfortunately, there is no way for me to currently check the logic of this aside from black boxing each command. I can't see how they work in consort until we get a viable testbed setup to run a full job from start to finish.

Finished the majority of the logic for the updateall method as well as changed the way we handle static paths in the code.

Since we end up referencing a lot of the same data (at least 2 or 3 times) across the project, I setup a class that will get all of the data paths if it is given the uuid of the particular job.

I also changed the way I handle the step storage and reference as well. I passed that off to a file which can be accessed across the project. Static storage in a single class might have been ok, but there is no reason to not store it in another class in case I want to do something with it later.
Made headway on the check job status. There still needs to be more work done to it though.
In the process of rewriting the way we check for updates on the job. It is not done whatsoever. There is a lot of code to be written.

Added a bunch of linux commands to facilitate checking the job and what to do if there is an error or if it completed.

TODO: Need to add a status parameter for each assembler and the overall job in the model because we need to update them indep. of each other.

Restricted the access of the details page to the user that created the job.

To that end, I added an error page outlining the reason for the redirection.
Fixed a problem where deleting a URL textbox doesn't result in it actually getting removed.

Added a couple minor bug fixes.

Added some custom CSS that represents the feedback boxes that appear throughout the program. Instead of hardcoding it, might as well throw it into some custom css. To that point, I changed the way the output is shown across the website to be more uniform and mellow. It was bright yellow and red in some places.

Created a function to get a list of all the users so you know exactly who to reference when changing a user's roles or deleting them.

Added a stop-check to make sure that there isn't a single admin left when attempting to delete a user. To prevent lockout, I procluded the possibility of deleting a user if they are the LAST admin (aka 1 user with admin roles left).
Added the job view for the user so they can view all of their submitted jobs.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/taylorflatt/distributed-genomic-assembly.git
k

Merge pull request #3 from taylorflatt/SSH_Connection

Since the majority of the work for the SSH connection has been completed and tested, it is time to merge it with master and continue work on various other odds and ends to wrap up the alpha build.
Now returns a brief report of the user's account in terms of their permissions and quota acceptability.

Added parameter to the user's model that tracks whether they have completed the account verification on their BigDog account.

Successfully tested that the parameter defaults to false and changes on successfull completion of the verification tasks.

Fixed an issue where the controller wasn't being grabbed correctly when submitting the form.

Fixed an issue where the string being returned by the CheckQuotaType wasn't being parsed correctly.

Fixed an issue where multiple quotas were being reported by CheckQuotaSize.

Added some account verification steps so that we can make sure the user has sufficient quota and permissions to do the things that we need them to do. Plan to add a parameter to the model that reflects running this test to verify that we have checked these conditions.

There are two options that can be explored at this point. Run the verification at job submission or run it as a pre-check prior to submitting your first job. Both have their pros/cons. Currently moving forward with the latter.

Removed an old javascript call that should have been removed when it was moved to the end of the file.

Fixed an indexing issue and thereby fixed an issue where multiple textboxes didn't result in a concatenation of those textboxes into the url model parameter.

Added a helper class to parse the urls that we concat at form creation and then wget each one in succession.

Added in the rest of the calls we will have to make for the run to function properly.

There is a problem in the form creation when we concat the urls where it isn't being done properly.
Added method for compressing folders.
Fixed logic so all paths return a value in GetCurrentStep.
Fixed some logic that needed to be moved up one code block for it to evaluate properly.
Added the basic logic behind the checkjoberror that needs fleshed out further. The command is functional however.

Changed the way GetCurrentStep handles the information. I now pass in a Tuple that will generalize the method allowing it to deal with a single job or n number of jobs. It still needs a bit more work.
Added the completed date to the model so we can have some sort of statistic for how long the job took from addition to the queue and to end.

Made some minor fixes.

Split up the sshconfig into multiple files since that better reflects what the methods do.

Still need to error test the new setup and complete checkjobstatus.cs.

Cleaned a bit of code up.

Changed the path to be in the config folder prior to calling the assemble script or adding it to the scheduler with qsub. However, I think that will be a problem since I ran into problems adding it to the queue when I wasn't on the login node. So we might need to address that by changing our pathing around a bit.

Added the method to get the current step.

Added functionality to choose the compute node that has the least amount of load currently on it.

Created a new model parameter to store the job id that is assigned to each job by the scheduler. That way we don't have to do any conversions or anything to check for job statuses. We just reference that parameter rather than UUID which is unique to the website.

Also changed most of the methods in SSHConfig to be more general/extendable.

Cleaned the code up as bit and added in some error checking for specific situations.

TODO: To fix the issue with permissions and checking on the status of a job, we need to change the directory to /tmp/Genome and chmod the folder for everyone to view and work with so we can update the information. Hopefully this is temporary. But that ought to work.

Forced connection error to go back to the last step.

Changed the way errors are handled and removed extra unnecessary code.

Added key-based authentication for our update account so the password doesn't need to be plaintext.

Changed the logic in the controller to match a more realistic setup. The error propogation needs to be tested again to make sure it still works with the changes.

Added functionality to grab the job number after the job is created. I may even toy with the idea of adding it to the model since that is our BigDog reference ID for the job in particular. OR even making that the UUID of the job.

The code has been verified to grab the BigDog job ID and parse it correctly.
Changed the way we construct the sshconfig object. Since there is more than one method we pass the parameters into the constructor instead.

Ignore the mess with this commit. I added some functionality to our SSHConfig and changed a few things and added a few variables to hold file names and paths. This was useful when calling ConfigBuilder and having it populate the scripts and config files.
Finished up the basic layout of the details page. It still lacks flair and is flat but for a basic layout it works. The UI improvements will come later.

Similar to the last commit, we don't want to show "Limit Jump Coverage" if we aren't using Jump Reads. So I hid that information unless Jump Reads is selected in the initial data step.

Added a few more things to the details page.

If paired-end reads is NOT selected in the initial data step, then we shouldn't be displaying paired-end information on the masurca step since that isn't required data at that point. Added logic to reflect that.
Changed the title of the website.
Merge branch 'SSH_Connection' of https://github.com/taylorflatt/distributed-genomic-assembly.git

Modified slightly for the CURCA presentation.

Completely redid the Create a Job wizard adding an additional step that more accurately represents the final look of the wizard.

Started modifying the Details page to what it should eventually look like.

Modified the controller to not actually connect with SSH to any server for the presentation.
Merge branch 'SSH_Connection' of https://github.com/taylorflatt/distributed-genomic-assembly.git
Added Getters and Setters for the URLs for each 3 configuration scripts. They also get returned when each function is called.

Added error handling so we can not only stop the connection if there is an error but also return the actual error to the user for further debugging and logging. Will eventually output this information to a log file as well.

Additionally, if there are any errors the model is NOT added to the db but is returned to the user for further inspection to make sure the information is good.

The path is still tentative. It will be passed from the ConfigBuilder which will contain the URL to the data to which I will append the name of the particular file for the wget.

All 3 config files are generated. MasurcaConfig appears to be completely finished. InitConfig can be edited with more commands easily. SchedulerConfig just has a test line writing to the file because I'm not sure what that should look like yet.

Cleaned up the global variables.

Changed the way the SSHConfig is called. The previous way would use an empty model that didn't contain the specific data that we needed. Now we are passing it into the class itself in a more concise manner.

Added more functionality that will reflect a more realistic environment.

Cleaned up some of the commands as well by passing in parameters that are more aptly named.

TODO: May still need to change the CWD from the logon node. That has yet to be tested.
Setup the SSH script for the config builder. Nothing more can really be done until that is up and functioning so I know where all the files will be located.
Update README.md
Update README.md
Update README.md
Update README.md

Update README.md

Added more relevant information.
Delete ManageRolesController - Copy.cs

Merge pull request #2 from taylorflatt/AssemblerWizard

Assembler wizard is mostly up and running with maybe a few additional tweaks to the UI and validation in the future.
test
Removed old files.

Finished the JS validation (as much as we can know right now) and fixed some validation that wasn't working correctly.

Redirected the user to the details page of the job they just created.

Added some tweaks to the model page for display names of some data.

As it stands now, the wizard is good to go aside from UI changes.

Made the jellyfish size a requirement since that is a calculation we cannot do (since we get the data only at run time and thus don't know the size).

Added URL validation to make sure that no matter how many textboxes there are for the URL, there must be at least something entered.

Added validation for step 2 with warning messages.

Looked into regex to validate URLs. I may end up just doing very basic stuff such as making sure it starts with www. or http(s)://. I can't find any decent regex that works 100% of the time for all possible cases.  At least nothing I trust enough to put into production. Maybe passing the burden off to the user might be the best bet. Just throw a warning in to double check the URL.

Fixed JS error when conating potentially multiple URLs.

Added the SSH info to the model without adding a column to the DB since we want to dispose of that information. Successfully connected to a remote host with the information passed from the View.
Removed migrations.
Took out inline JS and put it into it's own file. Also fixed issue with appending url to DataSource on submission.

Added a initial empty string value for the data source to prevent page load problems when referencing an uninitialized object.

Added dynamically added textboxes for n-number of URLs. There is a bug that I am currently working on however. When both functions appendURLBox and concatURLs are in the same code block, they conflict and neither will run. But I depend on the variable i which is incremented by appendURLBox to reference (and grab the value) in concatURLs.

Fixed the issue with the model not validating properly. MVC implicitly requires value types to have values so setting them to nullable serves two purposes:

(1) Solves the model validation problem.
(2) Allows me to catch the cases in which they didn't input a value and then set a default in its place before saving to the database so there will never been a null value in the DB.

Removed the .edmx in the web config since that is no longer required.

Remade the database so the correct table information was present.

Finished the delete user method so users are removed from logins/roles/user. All information is gone.

I changed the way roles worked a little bit. Admins can no longer be removed from the admin role or change to a different role. Once an admin - always an admin. Instead of creating a "super-admin", to prevent system lockout, I decided that if a user is added to the admin class then they should always be that class. The only way to remove the user from that class is to delete them from the database completely. This may change in the future if I can find an easier way to mitigate the possibility of system lock-out.

I removed a lot of required fields from the genome model but I am still having problems with the wizard beliving that JumpLength is a required field when is definitely is not. That is currently unresolved.

Added previous/next buttons and defaulted all steps other than 1 to hidden.

TODO: Add step-based validation.

Updated the create view considerably. Added the hide for the PE and Jump read options.

Removed old packages as well.

TODO: Add step-based hiding and turning the accepts into buttons. Still need to add the SSH into the last step as well.

Added ssh info to controller for testing.

Offloaded the heavy lifting to the configbuilder.

The sshconfig will only perform the WGETs to the server.

Changing approach to displaying the data. Going to start displaying the data on a single page first. Then slowly incorporating more features.

This is the single page with no fancy features and the create controller method is non-functional.

Changed approach.

Redid the controller for the genome model. I just need to add in the view front-end.

For some reason, even though my model has a key defined it still has problems dealing with the inheritance.

When attempting to update the database, I get the following errors:

Genome.Models.WizardValidationResult: : EntityType 'WizardValidationResult' has no key defined. Define the key for this EntityType.

WizardValidationResults: EntityType: EntitySet 'WizardValidationResults' is based on type 'WizardValidationResult' that has no keys defined.

I'm not really sure where to go from this point.

Redid the genome model to suit a wizard approach. Each data has an assigned step and clearly defined function now.

Added the Wizard package to facilitate this process.
Commit didn't work properly. Including the rest of the files.

Created scaffold for creating the config script for masurca as well as the SSH connection.

Haven't done much in the genome controller except to grab the user's job ID.

Plan to take a step back and make incremental steps to verify functionality before bringing everything back together.

Merge pull request #1 from taylorflatt/website-roles

Website roles

Compressed the Manage Users view into a single username/role box. This forced a bit of a rework in the controller.

Added the ability to delete a user but it has not been fully tested. The display and action of the button seem to function but the controller actually deleting the user has not been used quite yet. I plan to test that next time.

TODO: Tidy up code and document it a bit more.

Fixed a spelling error.

Added error checking for a user that is not in the database adding an error message for that event.

TODO: Change layout.

When changing roles of a user (as an admin), I made the roles mutually exclusive which cleaned up a decent amount of code.

Removed the option of creating user roles.

Cleaned up the Manage view.

Added some input validation on the forms and moved the error display to the top of the page and made it much more obvious.

TODO: I plan to revisit the layout of the Manage Roles to make it a bit more fluid and easier to use.

Added three user classes. We are using static classes because we know there will only need to be three roles. They are Unverified, Verified, and Admin.

Restricted the website to only verified users.

Provided redirections based on roles to the approriate informational pages.

Still need to remove the ability to add new roles. Decided to refrain from too many ambitious programming decisions.
Initial Framework.
Initial commit
